Transform the scaled 2D sketch into a 3D sketch using the euler angles and translation vector from the coordinate system. Extrude the 2D sketch by 0.1425 units towards the normal, creating the 3D model of a rectangular prism with a curved top and bottom. **Part 2: Create a cylindrical hole in the prism** Create a new coordinate system with Euler angles of [-90.0, 0.0, -90.0] and a translation vector of [0.4648, 0.0366, 0.0639]. The resulting 3D model should have dimensions of approximately 4 units long (along the x-axis), 2 units wide (along the y-axis), and 1 unit tall (along the z-axis) with a cylindrical hole of diameter 0.5 units.</description>
